text:
Would be nice if HS Employees in this slack had some consistent way of identifying they are HS employees. whether it be a profile pic template (add like a lil sprocket in the corner, or orange border or something) or another means if slack supports it.

Just don’t make :will:<@U6W3H6YN8>  lose his hair, I’ve been told that’s the source of his power.
Deep knowledge of HubSpot products isn't enough of an indicator?

I’ve just been talked to by a couple of HS employees who I’ve never really seen post in the slack. In the case of one of them I had no idea he was a HS employee until he told me.

The other person I knew he was, but his profile didn’t make it obvious,

Ideally it’d just be best practice if there were a way for them to display in a way that couldn’t be impersonated, that they are HS Employees.

could prevent someone being abusive claiming they’re a HS employee to gain someone’s trust for access to a portal or something like that. I realize it’s not something I’ve heard of happening here, it’s just a possibility.
That's fair.  I was attempting a joke
sorry for killing the joke
It's fine... it wasn't the best attempt

I will admit there are definitely some employees on here that don’t really need it.

I mean when you see some go “wish HubSpot could do ___” a minute later
:coley:  - “gimmie a few minutes”
Feature request - ability to search for templates and modules using their ID in the design manager finder
Orange background maybe?
or orange border.
I changed my status to :sprocket: . Does that work?
<@U22PKFRU5>
It’s better than nothing, unfortunately there’s no way to prevent non HS employees from doing it to impersonate, but atleast if they were an active user someone would catch them in the act
Maybe the template should just be people's faces but with my hair... :will:
Inbound 2019 - “We’ve been doing a lot for our dev community this year, including making it more obvious who our employees are on the slack channel by willifying them”
Inbound 2020 - “our graphic design team says they had to hire an intern just to perform the willifying”
For a recent hack project, I wrote some code to stick a picture of every HubSpot employee’s head onto the body of a cat. I’m sure it could be modified to put on will’s hair instead
I love “Willifying”
<@U22PJPGK0> Like that dog in _Invasion of the Body Snatchers?_
never seen that movie, but probably
example
hahahah
this...is...amazing
Oh lord, <@U22PJPGK0> .  Aren't you supposed to be building me things :troll:

We do similar at my office, but instead of sword fighting:
Dog + Tug Toy + Computer chair = Inter-office Transportation System
I tweeted slack about this Idea <@U7SL518D6>, lets hope they respond with something like "Awwww yeahhhh, we're doing this" <https://twitter.com/ajlaporte/status/1092566460990398465>
Have been catching up all morning.. just seeing this. Laughed my ass off while reading.

I like <@U22PJPGK0> simple solution of :sprocket: next to names of HubSpotters. We'll start there and then keep it in mind for future updates or improvements. I'll email all the HubSpotters in here to update ... and please Keep me in the loop if there is still a lot of confusion in the future.
